query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Quando ambedue li figli di Latona, 2 coperti del Montone e de la Libra, 3 fanno de l’orizzonte insieme zona,
query.error: **English:** 1 When both the children of Latona, 2 covered by the Ram and the Scales, 3 make of the horizon a single zone,
query.result: 1 Þonne ægðer gebróðru Latónan, 2 beþeaht mid Ramme and mid Wæge, 3 wyrcað him betwux horna gehæfte,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 quant’ è dal punto che ’l cenìt inlibra 5 infin che l’uno e l’altro da quel cinto, 6 cambiando l’emisperio, si dilibra,
query.error: **English:** 4 as far as from the point where the zenith balances 5 until both, from that belt, 6 changing hemispheres, balance each other,
query.result: 4 swa feor swa fram ðæm stede ðe seó sunne onliht 5 oð ðæt híe begen of ðæm girdle, 6 wrixlende heora heolfre, gehliden,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 tanto, col volto di riso dipinto, 8 si tacque Bëatrice, riguardando 9 fiso nel punto che m’avëa vinto.
query.error: **English:** 7 so, with her face painted with laughter, 8 Beatrice fell silent, gazing fixedly 9 at the point that had conquered me.
query.result: 7 swa, mid ðæm ansyne mid wynne geglencged, 8 geswæg Béatrice, wlítende 9 fæste on ðæm stede ðe mé oferwunnen hæfde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Poi cominciò: «Io dico, e non dimando, 11 quel che tu vuoli udir, perch’ io l’ho visto 12 là ’ve s’appunta ogne ubi e ogne quando.
query.error: **English:** 10 Then he began: "I say, and do not ask, 11 what you want to hear, because I saw it 12 there where every where and every when is focused."
query.result: 10 Þa ongan he secgan: "Ic secge, and ne ascie, 11 ðæt ðu wilt gehyran, forðæm ic hit geseah 12 ðær ælc hwär and ælc hwænne is gegaderod."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Non per aver a sé di bene acquisto, 14 ch’esser non può, ma perché suo splendore 15 potesse, risplendendo, dir “Subsisto”,
query.error: **English:** 13 Not in order to have for itself a good acquired, 14 which cannot be, but so that its splendor 15 might, by shining, say “I exist”,
query.result: 13 Nis ðæt for ðon ðæt hit ðæs gōdan ongiete, 14 ðæt nis mēglic, ac for ðon ðæt his scīma 15 mōste, scīnende, secgan “Ic eom”,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 in sua etternità di tempo fore, 17 fuor d’ogne altro comprender, come i piacque, 18 s’aperse in nuovi amor l’etterno amore.
query.error: **English:** 16 in its eternity of time before, 17 outside of every other comprehension, as it pleased it, 18 the eternal love opened itself in new loves.
query.result: 16 on his ēce tīman tōforan, 17 būtan ælcon ōðrum andgiete, swā him gelicode, 18 on nīwum lufe untīede se ēca lufu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Né prima quasi torpente si giacque; 20 ché né prima né poscia procedette 21 lo discorrer di Dio sovra quest’ acque.
query.error: **English:** 19 Nor did it lie still, as if torpid, before; 20 for neither before nor afterwards 21 did the word of God proceed over these waters.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Forma e materia, congiunte e purette, 23 usciro ad esser che non avia fallo, 24 come d’arco tricordo tre saette.
query.error: **English:** 22 Form and matter, joined and yet pure, 23 came forth to be that which had no fault, 24 like three arrows from a three-stringed bow.
query.result: 22 Hiw and hraw, gegaderode and þeah hwæðre clæne, 23 comon to wæsanne ðæt næfre nænig unriht hæfde, 24 swa ðreo strælas of anum bogan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 E come in vetro, in ambra o in cristallo 26 raggio resplende sì, che dal venire 27 a l’esser tutto non è intervallo,
query.error: **English:** 25 And as in glass, in amber, or in crystal 26 a ray gleams so that between its coming 27 and its being there is no interval,
query.result: 25 And swa swa on glæs, on eofore oððe on gimme 26 beorhtnes scineð swa ðæt of ðam cuman 27 oð ðæt hit eal sie nis nan fyrstgemearc,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 così ’l triforme effetto del suo sire 29 ne l’esser suo raggiò insieme tutto 30 sanza distinzïone in essordire.
query.error: **English:** 28 so the threefold effect of its Maker 29 in its being shone forth all at once 30 without distinction in its beginning.
query.result: 28 swa ðæs Dryhtnes ðreo-fealde miht 29 on his wæsene scán ætgædere eal 30 butan todælede on ðam fruman.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Concreato fu ordine e costrutto 32 a le sustanze; e quelle furon cima 33 nel mondo in che puro atto fu produtto;
query.error: **English:** 31 Order was created and constructed 32 for the substances; and they were the summit 33 in the world in which pure act was produced;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 pura potenza tenne la parte ima; 35 nel mezzo strinse potenza con atto 36 tal vime, che già mai non si divima.
query.error: **English:** 34 pure potency held the lowest part; 35 in the middle, potency with act bound together 36 such a bond that it can never be broken.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Ieronimo vi scrisse lungo tratto 38 di secoli de li angeli creati 39 anzi che l’altro mondo fosse fatto;
query.error: **English:** 37 Jerome wrote to you at great length 38 about the centuries of the created angels 39 before the other world was made;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 ma questo vero è scritto in molti lati 41 da li scrittor de lo Spirito Santo, 42 e tu te n’avvedrai se bene agguati;
query.error: **English:** 40 but this truth is written in many places 41 by the writers of the Holy Spirit, 42 and you will perceive it if you pay close attention;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 e anche la ragione il vede alquanto, 44 che non concederebbe che ’ motori 45 sanza sua perfezion fosser cotanto.
query.error: **English:** 43 and reason also sees it to some extent, 44 for it would not allow that the movers 45 should be so lacking in their own perfection.
query.result: 43 and eac ðæt gescead hit sumu gesihð, 44 forðan hit ne geðafode ðæt ða styrendan 45 butan heora fullfremednesse swa micle wæron.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 Or sai tu dove e quando questi amori 47 furon creati e come: sì che spenti 48 nel tuo disïo già son tre ardori.
query.error: **English:** 46 Now do you know where, when, and how this love 47 was created, so that already three fires are extinguished 48 in your desire.
query.result: 46 Nu ðu wast hwær and hwanne ðas lufan 47 wurdon acendede and hu: swa ðæt acwencte 48 on ðinum willan ða þreo fyras.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Né giugneriesi, numerando, al venti 50 sì tosto, come de li angeli parte 51 turbò il suggetto d’i vostri alimenti.
query.error: **English:** 49 Nor would you reach, by counting, twenty, 50 so quickly, as a part of the angels 51 disturbed the subject of your nourishment.
query.result: 49 Ne ðu ðær gerihte ðurh gerim to twenti 50 swa hraðe, swa ðara engla sum 51 ðinre bigleofan ðone bryttan gewemde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 L’altra rimase, e cominciò quest’ arte 53 che tu discerni, con tanto diletto, 54 che mai da circüir non si diparte.
query.error: **English:** 52 The other remained, and began this art 53 that you perceive, with so much delight, 54 that it never departs from its circling.
query.result: 52 Seo oðer ðær wunode and ða weorc ongann, 53 ðe ðu ðær gesihst, mid ði micle gefean, 54 ðæt hit næfre ðæs ymbwyrnes forlæt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 Principio del cader fu il maladetto 56 superbir di colui che tu vedesti 57 da tutti i pesi del mondo costretto.
query.error: **English:** 55 The beginning of the fall was the accursed 56 pride of him whom you saw 57 weighed down by all the burdens of the world.
query.result: 55 Frumsceaft felles wæs se feondlice 56 ofermod ðæs ðe ðu ðær gesawe 57 ealra worulda wæge geþrungen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 Quelli che vedi qui furon modesti 59 a riconoscer sé da la bontate 60 che li avea fatti a tanto intender presti:
query.error: **English:** 58 Those whom you see here were modest 59 in acknowledging themselves from the goodness 60 that had made them so ready to understand:
query.result: 58 Þa þe þu her gesihst wæron gemetfæste 59 to oncnawenne heom sylfum fram þære godnesse 60 þe heom hæfde gemacod swa gearwe to understandenne:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 per che le viste lor furo essaltate 62 con grazia illuminante e con lor merto, 63 si c’hanno ferma e piena volontate;
query.error: **English:** 61 therefore their sight was exalted 62 with illuminating grace and with their merit, 63 so that they have firm and full will;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 e non voglio che dubbi, ma sia certo, 65 che ricever la grazia è meritorio 66 secondo che l’affetto l’è aperto.
query.error: **English:** 64 and I do not want you to doubt, but be certain, 65 that receiving grace is meritorious 66 according to how open the affection is to it.
query.result: 64 and ic nelle þæt þu tweoge, ac beo þæs georn, 65 þæt underfon þa gyfe is geearnung 66 æfter þæm þe se wilnung him is open.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Omai dintorno a questo consistorio 68 puoi contemplare assai, se le parole 69 mie son ricolte, sanz’ altro aiutorio.
query.error: **English:** 67 Oh, you who are gathered around this assembly, 68 you can contemplate much, if my words 69 are understood, without any other help.
query.result: 67 Eala ðu ðe eart ymb ðisne heahsetl gegaderod, 68 ðu miht ðær fela geseon, gif ða word mine 69 sind gerecced, butan ænigum oðrum fultum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 Ma perché ’n terra per le vostre scole 71 si legge che l’angelica natura 72 è tal, che ’ntende e si ricorda e vole,
query.error: **English:** 70 But why is it that in your schools on earth 71 it is taught that angelic nature 72 is such that it understands, remembers, and wills,
query.result: 70 Ac hwi on eorðan on eowrum scolu 71 is gerædd ðæt ðæs engles gecynd 72 sie swylc ðæt he ongiete and geman and wille,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 ancor dirò, perché tu veggi pura 74 la verità che là giù si confonde, 75 equivocando in sì fatta lettura.
query.error: **English:** 73 I will say more, so that you may see purely 74 the truth that is confused down there, 75 equivocating in such a reading.
query.result: 73 ic wille ðeah secgan, ðæt ðu ðone soð gesio, 74 ðe ðær beneoðan bið awend, 75 mislic ðurh ða rædinge.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 Queste sustanze, poi che fur gioconde 77 de la faccia di Dio, non volser viso 78 da essa, da cui nulla si nasconde:
query.error: **English:** 76 These substances, after they were joyful 77 in the sight of God, did not turn their face 78 from it, from which nothing is hidden:
query.result: 76 Þas gesceaftas, siððan hie wæron glæde 77 on ðæs Godes gesyhðe, ne woldon hie gewendan 78 fram ðære, ðe nanwuht ne bið hyde:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 però non hanno vedere interciso 80 da novo obietto, e però non bisogna 81 rememorar per concetto diviso;
query.error: **English:** 79 therefore they have their sight not cut off 80 by a new object, and therefore there is no need 81 to remember through divided thought;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 sì che là giù, non dormendo, si sogna, 83 credendo e non credendo dicer vero; 84 ma ne l’uno è più colpa e più vergogna.
query.error: **English:** 82 so that down there, without sleeping, one dreams, 83 believing and not believing to speak the truth; 84 but in the one there is more fault and more shame.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 Voi non andate giù per un sentiero 86 filosofando: tanto vi trasporta 87 l’amor de l’apparenza e ’l suo pensiero!
query.error: **English:** 85 You do not go down a path 86 philosophizing: so much does 87 the love of appearance and its thought transport you!
query.result: 85 Ge ne gaoð adûne be anre stige 86 on gesprec: swa micel eow gebringð 87 lufu ðæs ansŷnes and his geþōht!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 E ancor questo qua sù si comporta 89 con men disdegno che quando è posposta 90 la divina Scrittura o quando è torta.
query.error: **English:** 88 And even this up here behaves 89 with less disdain than when 90 divine Scripture is neglected or twisted.
query.result: 88 And eac ðis her uppan geþafað 89 mid læssan yrmðu ðonne bið âworpen 90 halige gewritu oððe bið âwend.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 Non vi si pensa quanto sangue costa 92 seminarla nel mondo e quanto piace 93 chi umilmente con essa s’accosta.
query.error: **English:** 91 One does not think how much blood it costs 92 to sow it in the world, and how much it pleases 93 him who humbly approaches it.
query.result: 91 Ne ðæs mon mæg geðencan hu micel blod 92 hit costie ðæt hit wære on woruld gesawen, 93 and hu ðam ðe hit eadmodlice onfeng wel licode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 Per apparer ciascun s’ingegna e face 95 sue invenzioni; e quelle son trascorse 96 da’ predicanti e ’l Vangelio si tace.
query.error: **English:** 94 To appear, each one exerts himself and makes 95 his own inventions; and those are spread abroad 96 by the preachers, and the Gospel is silent.
query.result: 94 To ði ðæt æghwilc hine sylfne onwrige and wyrceð 95 his agenra gesceafta; and ða beoð awende 96 fram ðam bodum, and ðæt Godspell bið gestilled.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 Un dice che la luna si ritorse 98 ne la passion di Cristo e s’interpuose, 99 per che ’l lume del sol giù non si porse;
query.error: **English:** 97 One says that the moon turned away 98 in the passion of Christ and interposed itself, 99 so that the light of the sun did not shine down;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 e mente, ché la luce si nascose 101 da sé: però a li Spani e a l’Indi 102 come a’ Giudei tale eclissi rispuose.
query.error: **English:** 100 and he is wrong, because the light hid 101 of its own accord: therefore to the Spanish and to the Indians 102 as to the Jews such an eclipse appeared.
query.result: 100 and he lyhð, forðæm ðæt leoht hyde 101 of ðam sylfum: ðurh ðæt ðam Spanum and ðam Indiscum 102 swa swa ðam Iudeum swylc eclipse andwyrde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Non ha Fiorenza tanti Lapi e Bindi 104 quante sì fatte favole per anno 105 in pergamo si gridan quinci e quindi:
query.error: **English:** 103 Florence has not so many Lapi and Bindis 104 as there are such fables every year 105 shouted from the pulpit here and there:
query.result: 103 Næfð Florencia swa fela Lapi and Bindi 104 swa swylce gedreama gehwylcum geare 105 on stigecleopum clypiad her and þær:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 sì che le pecorelle, che non sanno, 107 tornan del pasco pasciute di vento, 108 e non le scusa non veder lo danno.
query.error: **English:** 106 so that the little sheep, who do not know, 107 return from pasture fed on wind, 108 and their not seeing the harm does not excuse them.
query.result: 106 swa þæt þa sceap, þe ne cunnon, 107 cumað of foldan gewiðmætum fædde, 108 and heora ne gescyldad þæt hi ne geseoð þone sceaðan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 e quel tanto sonò ne le sue guance, 113 sì ch’a pugnar per accender la fede 114 de l’Evangelio fero scudo e lance.
query.error: **English:** 112 and that resounded so clearly from his lips, 113 that in order to fight for and kindle the faith 114 of the Gospel they made shield and lance.
query.result: 112 and ðæt swilce hlynode on his wange, 113 ðæt hi for ðære geleafan lufan woldon 114 ðæs Godspelles feohtan mid sceolde and mid spere.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 Ora si va con motti e con iscede 116 a predicare, e pur che ben si rida, 117 gonfia il cappuccio e più non si richiede.
query.error: **English:** 115 Now one goes preaching with jests and gibes, 116 and provided that one makes people laugh, 117 one's hood swells up and nothing more is required.
query.result: 115 Nu mon gæð mid tæfle and mid gligge 116 bodian, and ðeah ðe man wel hleahtrige, 117 þonne bið his hod tobrocen and na mare ne þearf.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Ma tale uccel nel becchetto s’annida, 119 che se ’l vulgo il vedesse, vederebbe 120 la perdonanza di ch’el si confida:
query.error: **English:** 118 But such a bird nests in its little beak, 119 that if the common people saw it, they would see 120 the pardon in which it trusts:
query.result: 118 Ac swylc fugel on his bile snyrðeð, 119 ðæt ðe folc hit gesawe, hit gesawe 120 ða forgifnesse ðe he on gehyrðe:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 per cui tanta stoltezza in terra crebbe, 122 che, sanza prova d’alcun testimonio, 123 ad ogne promession si correrebbe.
query.error: **English:** 121 because of which so much foolishness grew on earth, 122 that, without proof of any testimony, 123 people would rush to any promise.
query.result: 121 ðurh ða ðe swa micel dysig on eorðan weox, 122 ðæt, butan gewitnesse æniges gewitan, 123 to ælcre behate man arn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Di questo ingrassa il porco sant’ Antonio, 125 e altri assai che sono ancor più porci, 126 pagando di moneta sanza conio.
query.error: **English:** 124 Saint Anthony fattens himself on this, 125 and many others who are even greater pigs, 126 paying with counterfeit money.
query.result: 124 Þisum fætt se swin Sancte Anthoni, 125 and eac swilce manega othre, 126 þeáh þe hi swin syndon mare.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Ma perché siam digressi assai, ritorci 128 li occhi oramai verso la dritta strada, 129 sì che la via col tempo si raccorci.
query.error: **English:** 127 But since we have digressed too much, turn 128 your eyes now back to the straight road, 129 so that the way may be shortened with time.
query.result: 127 Ac forðæm we sind gefarenne to feor, gecyrre 128 ðine eagan nu eft to ðæm rihtan wege, 129 ðæt ðeos weg mæge beon gemet mid ðære tide.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Questa natura sì oltre s’ingrada 131 in numero, che mai non fu loquela 132 né concetto mortal che tanto vada;
query.error: **English:** 130 This nature is so pleasing in number 131 that no speech or mortal concept 132 can ever reach so far;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 e se tu guardi quel che si revela 134 per Danïel, vedrai che ’n sue migliaia 135 determinato numero si cela.
query.error: **English:** 133 and if you look at what is revealed 134 by Daniel, you will see that in his thousands 135 a definite number is concealed.
query.result: 133 and gif ðu gehyrðst ðæt ðe Daniel 134 be his þusendum sæde, ðu gesyhst ðæt þær 135 gerim gerimed is.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 La prima luce, che tutta la raia, 137 per tanti modi in essa si recepe, 138 quanti son li splendori a chi s’appaia.
query.error: **English:** 136 The first light, which bathes it all, 137 is received in it in as many ways 138 as there are splendors to which it is joined.
query.result: 136 Se forma ðe ðære forman leohte, ðe ealle ða gesceafta gelihteð, 137 on ðam heofonlicum ðinge bið on ða wisan onfangen, 138 swa fela swa ðæra ðinga bið ðe ðære leohte onlihteð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 Onde, però che a l’atto che concepe 140 segue l’affetto, d’amar la dolcezza 141 diversamente in essa ferve e tepe.
query.error: **English:** 139 Therefore, since the act of conceiving 140 is followed by the affection of loving the sweetness, 141 it boils and grows warm in it in different ways.
query.result: 139 Forðæm, ðurh ðæt ðe ðæm dædum ðe onfehð 140 fyligeð ðæt geswenced ðæs swetan lufian, 141 on ðam ðingum mislice hyt wyrmð and hreðð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 Vedi l’eccelso omai e la larghezza 143 de l’etterno valor, poscia che tanti 144 speculi fatti s’ha in che si spezza,
query.error: **English:** 142 Now you see the lofty height and the breadth 143 of the eternal value, since it has made so many 144 mirrors in which it is broken up,
query.result: 142 Nu ðu ðone heahnisse and ða brædu gesyhst 143 ðæs ecan weorðmyndes, syððan swa fela 144 bysne geworhte wæs on ðam hit tobrytt wæs,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
145 uno manendo in sé come davanti».
query.error: **English:** 145 while remaining one in itself as before.
query.result: 145 an wunigende on him sylfum swa he ær dyde.
